author: sproul
content:
I think I was wrong about consensus-specs, I was thinking of the current API spec for `POST /eth/v1/beacon/blocks` which says to only publish gossip-valid messages

I still think if we want to allow more liberal publishing rules it would be nice to tweak the gossip conditions themselves

author: tbenr
content: an option could to not enforce GOSSIP as a default of `broadcast_validation` param, and leave to a BN configuration how to behave (and in my view is still to not do any validation at all)

author: nflaig
content: In Lodestar we only run gossip validation if the block was not produced locally (via root lookup), in the happy case, we don't add any extra work / latency during publishing. We also added `broadcast_validation=none` but that's just for testing purposes right now and default is still `gossip`.

author: tbenr
content: that's the reason why our VC is still using V1. In V2 we adhere to default GOSSIP and we don't want to introduce additional checks in our OOTB flow.
